author: Shawn Donnan, Chris Kennedy, Adrienne Tong
description: Bloomberg Economics analysis shows real investment commitments closer to $7 trillion and many of those are in question.
title: Trump’s $21 Trillion Investment Boom Is Actually Short Trillions

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump signed an executive order Monday establishing the “Genesis Mission,” a federal effort to boost innovation using artificial intelligence — the latest step by the administration to promote AI technology and its adoption.
title: Trump Signs ‘Genesis Mission’ Order to Boost Innovation With AI

author: Nick Wadhams
description: President Donald Trump ordered his administration to study labeling some parts of the Muslim Brotherhood as foreign terrorist organizations, a step toward fulfilling his longtime goal of slapping the designation on the broader group.
title: Trump Takes Step Toward Terrorism Label for Muslim Brotherhood

author: Courtney McBride
description: The chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff is traveling through Latin America as tensions between the US and Venezuela remain elevated and the Trump administration has designated the leadership in Caracas as a foreign terrorist organization.
title: Top US Military Officer to Visit Region Amid Venezuela Tensions

author: Nathan R Dean
description: The president’s proposal was supposed to come this week.
title: Trump Still Wrestling With His Own Plan to Fix Healthcare Costs

author: Patricia Hurtado, Miles J. Herszenhorn
description: The Justice Department asked federal judges to unseal grand jury material from the criminal cases against Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, citing the recently enacted law on Epstein documents.
title: DOJ Renews Push to Unseal Epstein, Maxwell Grand Jury Materials

author: Michelle Jamrisko, Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump struck a positive tone on the prospects for a ceasefire in Ukraine after a weekend of talks narrowed disagreements over his latest peace proposal, even as the discussions exposed a Republican rift over how to confront President Vladimir Putin.
title: Trump Voices Hope Over Ukraine Deal After Weekend of Talks

author: Zoe Tillman
description: The Trump administration is fighting efforts by government workers and contractors to force billionaire Elon Musk to testify in a lawsuit that accuses him of unlawfully directing the dissolution of the US Agency for International Development while he was a senior adviser to the president.
title: Trump Administration Fights Bid to Get Musk to Testify on DOGE

author: Josh Wingrove, Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: President Donald Trump is still working on a proposal to address a spike in Obamacare health insurance premiums, but the eventual plan may differ significantly from details reported over the weekend, the White House said Monday.
title: Trump Still Working on Health-Care Proposal, White House Says

author: Sarah Holder, Rachael Lewis-Krisky
description: Today on the Big Take: As Trump confronts new pressures over affordability, he’s proposed a plan that faces some major roadblocks.
title: Why Trump’s $2,000 Tariff Rebate Plan Is a Hard Sell With His Allies

author: Liam Knox
description: The US Department of Education is facing an existential threat under President Donald Trump.
title: Trump Is Dismantling the Education Department. What’s at Stake.

author: Samuel Stolton, Jorge Valero
description: The European Union’s antitrust chief ruled out easing the bloc’s tech rulebook, after US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said Brussels needed to change its digital regulations in order to get a deal to lower steel and aluminum tariffs.
title: EU Rejects US Demand to Ease Tech Rules for Lower Steel Tariffs

author: Petra Sorge
description: Germany plans to hold auctions to for the construction of new gas-fired power plants in March 2026, Economy Minister Katherina Reiche said in Berlin.
title: Germany to Solicit Bids for Gas Plants in March, Minister Says

author: Nacha Cattan
description: Kathy Wylde, head of the Partnership for New York City, will join the transition team of Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani, adding a pro-business voice to the democratic socialist’s roster of allies.
title: Mamdani Taps NYC Business Advocate Wylde for Transition Team

author: Zoe Tillman
description: The Justice Department argued in court for more expansive executive power to limit White House access based on political expression, including for events historically open to the general public such as tours or the annual Easter egg roll.
title: White House Access Limits Could Cover Easter Egg Roll, DOJ Says

author: Alex Wickham, Ellen Milligan
description: Chancellor Rachel Reeves will slash the amount Britons can save in their tax-free cash ISA each year to £12,000 in a bid to get households investing more in UK stocks.
title: Reeves to Slash Annual Cash ISA Limit to £12,000 in UK Budget

author: Madlin Mekelburg
description: The group of voters suing to block a Republican-drawn congressional map in Texas urged the US Supreme Court to reject the new district lines and called for next year’s midterm election to be conducted using the state’s existing map.
title: Supreme Court Urged to Reject GOP-Drawn Texas Voting Maps

author: Brian Platt, Josh Wingrove, Derek Decloet
description: Trade talks between the US and Canada remain stalled, and there’s an emerging belief in both governments that key issues will be rolled into next year’s broader review of the North American trade accord, people familiar with the matter said.
title: US-Canada Trade Talks Frozen as Carney Weighs DC Trip Next Week

author: Chris Strohm
description: A federal judge threw out the criminal charges against former FBI Director James Comey and New York Attorney General Letitia James, ruling that the prosecutor who brought the cases had been illegally appointed.
title: James Comey, Letitia James Charges Dismissed by US Judge

author: Michelle Jamrisko
description: The Pentagon has started a probe into Democratic Senator Mark Kelly after President Donald Trump called for punishing a group of lawmakers who publicly advised intelligence community and military members to disobey orders that would break the law.
title: Pentagon Probes Democratic Senator Kelly Over Video to Troops

author: Katrina Manson
description: An AI startup has won a seven-year contract to supply data labeling for artificial intelligence and machine learning for the US Department of Defense and intelligence community, beating out a larger rival, Scale AI Inc.
title: Scale AI Loses to Smaller Startup in Bid for US Intel Work

author: Max Rivera
description: Rick Cotton, the executive director of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, who oversaw major revitalization efforts and infrastructure developments across New York City and parts of New Jersey, will retire in January, the agency announced on Monday.
title: Rick Cotton, Head of NY and NJ’s Port Authority, to Retire at 81

author: Jim Wyss, Jennifer Zabasajja
description: The growing US military threat to Venezuela is spreading unease among Caribbean islands that depend on tourism to sustain their vulnerable economies.
title: Caribbean Islands Fear US-Venezuela Tensions Will Hurt Tourism

author: Jorge Valero
description: The European Union wants the US to reduce tariffs on the bloc’s exports of weapons below the 15% tariff ceiling agreed for many of its goods.
title: EU Asks US to Cut Tariffs on Flamethrowers and Grenade Launchers

description: The BBC's chairman acknowledged it was too slow in responding over a misleading edit of a speech by Trump.
title: BBC Leaders Grilled by Lawmakers Over Standards After Trump Threatens to Sue

author: Josh Wingrove
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping pressed US President Donald Trump on the status of the self-governing island of Taiwan and urged his counterpart to maintain improved ties, according to the Chinese Foreign Ministry.
title: Xi Presses Trump on Taiwan Amid Spat With Japan, China Says

author: Donato Paolo Mancini
description: Incumbent political coalitions seemed on track to retain the governorship of three Italian regions, according to preliminary data on Monday, as the country gears up for a general election that could take place as early as next year.
title: Italian Voters Confirm Incumbent Coalitions in Three Regions

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court refused to revive a $900,000 jury verdict won by a former UBS Group AG research strategist who claimed he was fired for not skewing his reports to help the company’s business strategies.
title: Fired UBS Strategist Rejected by Supreme Court on Whistleblowing

author: Maggie Eastland
description: President Donald Trump is weighing whether to allow Nvidia Corp. to sell advanced artificial intelligence chips to China and will be the one to make a final decision on the matter, US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said.
title: Trump Weighing Advanced Nvidia Chip Sales to China, Lutnick Says

author: Ruth Olurounbi
description: Nigeria said the US is ready to help it tackle violent extremism that President Donald Trump has characterized as targeting Christians in the West African nation.
title: US to Deepen Nigeria Security Ties to Help Stem Militant Attacks

author: Augusta Saraiva
description: A majority of judges on a Brazil Supreme Court panel upheld the arrest of Jair Bolsonaro, voting to keep the former right-wing president behind bars while he awaits the start of a 27-year sentence for plotting a coup attempt.
title: Brazil’s Top Court Upholds Bolsonaro Arrest, Leaving Him Behind Bars

author: Peter Laca
description: The three parties preparing to form the next Czech government rejected the outgoing administration’s draft budget for next year, saying the plan lacked financing for key spending areas.
title: Czech Election Winners See $4.5 Billion Funding Gap in Budget

author: Shruti Mahajan
description: India’s Supreme Court has agreed to quash all criminal charges against Nitin and Chetan Sandesara, brothers who built one of Nigeria’s leading oil companies, after agreeing to a one-time settlement of 51 billion rupees ($572 million) in a bank fraud case.
title: India Top Court Drops Case Against Sandesaras After Settlement

author: Jorge Valero, Lisa Abramowicz, Dani Burger
description: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said the European Union needs to change its digital regulations in order to get a deal to lower steel and aluminum tariffs.
title: Lutnick Says EU Must Relax Digital Rules For Lower Steel Tariffs

author: Nectar Gan, Lucille Liu
description: In the roughly three weeks since Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi commented on a possible Taiwan contingency in parliament, China has unleashed economic reprisals, nationalist barbs and a diplomatic offensive to show its displeasure.
title: China Uses Japan Spat to Pressure World to Pick Sides on Taiwan

author: Emily Birnbaum, Michael Smith
description: The bitter decades-long feud between Big Sugar and Big Candy began to ease in a conference room at Washington’s Four Seasons hotel, where more than 40 lobbyists faced off, divided by a table and trays of pastries.
title: Candymakers’ Hard-Won Deal With Big Sugar Shows Clout of Washington Lobbies

author: Matthew Malinowski
description: Chile ultra-conservative presidential candidate José Antonio Kast secured a commanding double-digit lead in the first polls taken since he and a leftist rival advanced to the country’s runoff vote.
title: Chile Presidential Candidate Kast Holds Double-Digit Poll Lead

author: William Horobin
description: French Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu said he still sees a path for parliament to approve a budget after the National Assembly voted against the tax chapter of the bill in the first reading.
title: France’s Lecornu Says Budget Still Viable After Tax-Plan Rebuff

author: Ana Monteiro
description: Retail billionaire Christo Wiese said South Africa should “know its place” amid fraught ties with the US and be “very diplomatic” in its approach to Washington.
title: Billionaire Wiese Urges South Africa to Tread Carefully With US

author: Mario Parker
description: Both Ukraine and the US struck a positive tone after talks.
title: Buying Time to Reshape Trump Plans for Ukraine

author: Milda Seputyte, Oliver Crook
description: The European Union must move urgently on tapping Russian frozen assets as a way to gain a seat at the negotiating table over peace in Ukraine, Lithuania’s top diplomat said.
title: EU Must Make a Move on Frozen Russian Assets, Lithuania Says

author: Jorge Valero
description: The European Union said no deal was expected Monday to lower tariffs on steel and other products during talks with senior US trade officials.
title: EU Says No Tariff Deal Expected During US Officials’ First Visit

author: Antonio Barroso, Jean Dalbard
description: In the decade that followed the euro zone debt crisis, France stood out as an island of stability amid Europe’s turbulent politics. Spain was burdened by weak governments and serial elections, Italy’s deadlocked parties often left it to technocrats to run the country and the UK struggled through years of post-Brexit infighting and a revolving door at 10 Downing Street. Emmanuel Macron’s rise to power in 2017, by contrast, brought with it with a strong, coherent pro-business agenda backed, at lea
title: Why France’s Politics Are Broken — and What That Means for Its Economy

author: Lyubov Pronina, Suzanne Lynch
description: Belgium’s five-party coalition sealed a budget deal early on Monday, averting a possible government collapse and securing some much-needed political stability before several key decisions in the coming weeks.
title: Belgium Seals Budget Deal, Averting Political Instability

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. took a swipe at his sister, Imee, who publicly accused him of using illegal drugs at a time of growing public anger over corruption in the government.
title: ‘Not My Sister,’ Marcos Hits Back at Sibling Over Cocaine Claims

author: Olesia Safronova
description: Ukrainian and US negotiators prepared an “updated and refined framework document on peace,” according to a top aide to President Volodymyr Zelenskiy, as Kyiv sought more favorable terms from a proposal backed by Donald Trump.
title: Top Zelenskiy Aide Sees Progress on Peace Deal With New Document

author: Weilun Soon, Eko Listiyorini
description: The Indonesian government is auctioning off a US-sanctioned supertanker and its cargo of crude oil for at least $70 million, according to government documents seen by Bloomberg News.
title: Indonesia to Auction US-Sanctioned Supertanker It Seized in 2023

author: Josh Xiao, Felix Tam
description: Hong Kong Chief Executive John Lee cast doubt on the value of exchanges with Japan, bringing the Asian financial hub in line with Beijing’s broad cooling with Tokyo following a dispute over Taiwan.
title: Hong Kong Leader Questions Japan Ties Over Taiwan Remarks

author: Manolo Serapio Jr
description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said seven suspects tied to the corruption scandal on flood infrastructure are now in the custody of authorities, while efforts are underway to arrest those who are still at large.
title: Marcos Says Seven Suspects in Philippine Graft Scandal Detained

author: Oscar Medina
description: President Donald Trump’s formal designation of Venezuela’s Cartel de los Soles as a foreign terrorist organization will go into effect on Nov. 24, escalating tensions between the US and Venezuela.
title: US Terrorist Designation Targets Maduro’s Alleged Drug Network

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump said no television networks should be able to expand, citing the potential growth of what he considers left-wing news networks.
title: Trump Says Television Networks Shouldn’t Be Able to ‘Enlarge’

author: Vincent Lee
description: General Dan Caine, chairman of the US Joint Chiefs of Staff, will meet service members of the US Southern Command on Monday in Puerto Rico, where the American military presence has swelled as the Trump administration weighs military action against Venezuela.
title: US Joint Chiefs Chair to Visit Base Amid Venezuela Tensions

author: Ellen Milligan
description: The UK will cut energy bills by 25% for more than 7,000 manufacturers beginning in 2027 as the government attempts to charm businesses ahead of a tax-raising budget next week.
title: UK to Cut Business Energy Bills in Pre-Budget Charm Offensive
